original: ma h'a mantra aa nu dh'a ri ni s'a dha nam /
analyzed: ma h'a mantra aa nu dh'a ri ni s'a dha nam /

translated: In Tibetan:🔽The Means of Achievement of the Great Lady Who Sustains the Secret Mantra

original: gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma chen mo'i sgrub thabs 'phags ma gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma chen mo'i sgrub thabs 'phags ma gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Noble Lady Who Sustains the Secret Mantra.

original: gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin ma zhal gcig ma /
translated: The Lady Who Sustains the Secret Mantra has one face,

original: phyag bzhi ma /🔽nag mo g-yas kya phyag gnyis na ji lta bu'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: phyag bzhi ma / nag mo g-yas kya phyag gnyis na ji lta bu'i sbyor bas /

original: rdo rje dang / mchog sbyin pa'i phyag go //
analyzed: rdo rje dang / mchog sbyin pa'i phyag go //
translated: In her two right hands she makes the gesture of equanimity and holds a vajra and a boon-granting hand.

original: g-yon pa'i phyag gnyis na dgra sta dang zhags pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag gnyis na dgra sta dang zhags pa'o //
translated: In her two left hands she holds a battle-axe and a noose.

original: h'um gi sa bon can mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: h'um gi sa bon can mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan dang ldan pa /
translated: She has the seed syllable hūṃ and the crown of Akṣobhya.

original: nyi ma'i gdan dang / rgyab rten la sogs pa dang ldan pa sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gdan dang / rgyab rten la sogs pa dang ldan pa sngon bzhin no //
translated: She has a sun seat, a back-rest, and so forth, as before.

original: gsang sngags chen mo rjes su 'dzin ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: gsang sngags chen mo rjes su 'dzin ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs rdzogs so //
translated: The Means of Achievement of the Great Lady Who Sustains the Secret Mantra is complete.

original: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus so /
analyzed: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus so /
translated: It was translated, corrected, and finalized by the paṇḍita Amoghavajra and the translator-monk Chag Drakpa Jangchup.
